channel.title: Rejecto and fixed language model – Politepix

item.title: Rejecto and fixed language model
item.dc:creator: OT
item.description:
Is is possible to use Rejecto with the “fixed” language model, i.e. lm that’s built offline ahead of time (using QuickLM Sphynx tool)?

I only see

generateRejectingLanguageModelFromArray

method, which indicates this is not possible and that the only way to have Rejecto
work is via generateRejectingLanguageModelFromArray. Is that correct?

Thanks,
Ogi

item.title: Reply To: Rejecto and fixed language model
item.dc:creator: OT
item.description: On the same token, is it possible to use JSFG grammars with Rejecto? (although, I could pre-process these and create a corresponding network/lm, so it’s really the first question that I am most interested in)

item.title: Reply To: Rejecto and fixed language model
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description:
Hi Ogi,

Rejecto is a plugin that modifies LanguageModelGenerator so it can only be used with an ARPA lm generated by LanguageModelGenerator.
